Un clásico. Premisa interesante, mecánica a juego y argumento sorprendente. Como es un juego de puzzles pues al volver a jugarlo o te has olvidado ya de cómo se resuelven los niveles, o sólo te quedan algunos desafíos bonus, y disfrutar de la estética, la mecánica de portales, GLAdOS... Es como el Parque Jurásico de los juegos, es antiguo, y se nota, pero para lo que hay y lo que había envejece bastante bien.

I don't know what can be said about portal that has not already. It and the second game are with out a doubt the best puzzle games to ever be released. Unique physics with awesome humor and characters make for a game you can play over and over and over again.

Un gran juego con una gran historia la velda, un poco corta (demasiao a mi parecer xd) algo que solucionaron en portal 2 haciendola un poquito mas larga, pero igual se pasa bien durante todo el juego yo le doy su respectivo 7.5/10 B)

A quien lea esto, juegen a este milagro de videojuego, lo tiene todo, si son personas que quieren jugar por historia o para los tiempos muertos juegen la historia simplemente, ahora si realmente quieren un reto también los van a tener es más aún no pude pasar el de los pasos en la cámara 18. El único problema que le veo es que es corto si solo contamos la historia principal, en una tarde tranquilamente la terminan. MUST-PLAY.

One of my all-time favorites.  No matter how many times I failed or  died... over, and over, and over... (seriously, I kinda sucked at this game, but I didn't care!) it was so much fun!

Those portals - those cursed yet beloved portals - are what make this game so incredibly fascinating.  It is so refreshing to play a game where you have to study your environment, and puzzle out how to use your portals in that specific environment to achieve your objective. 

And just as a little side note - whoever came up with the concept of the Aperture A.I. is a freakin' genius.  The humor... oh the humor...  Imagine if Mel Brooks re-imagined 2001: A Space Odessy.  Lots of giggling during gameplay.
amazing. just amazing.

Portal is one of those games that feels so purely original and thoughtful that it's impossible to not recommend it to anybody interested in video games. The puzzles in this game are not only well crafted in how they teach you the game's mechanics, but almost all of them have multiple solutions. Though the game is only about 2 hours from beginning to end, the possibilities within this game are seemingly immeasurable. To truly see everything Portal has to offer, you will be playing this game over and over and over again, and that, in my opinion, is the mark of something truly special. And I haven't even mentioned the best part of this game, which is the writing. Though the only voice we ever hear comes from an AI, the dialogue spoken is witty and filled to the brim with dark comedy. A very strong recommendation to anybody who is has an interest in video games, hardcore gamers and newbies alike.
